Package co.cookies.sdk

Interface SDKServiceProvider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CookiesSDKManager
    public interface SDKServiceProvider
extends java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Specifies the API surface of an object which provides access to Cookies service clients.

    Typically, invoking code would use CookiesSDKManager (acquired via CookiesSDK.builder()) to access these methods.

    .

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default CatalogClient catalog()
      Access a pre-configured instance of the CatalogClient, which enables access to the Catalog API.
      CatalogClient catalog​(java.util.Optional<SDKConfiguration> serviceConfiguration)
      Configure and return a customized instance of the CatalogClient, which enables access to the Catalog API.
      default Storefront storefront()
      Access a pre-configured instance of the Storefront facade, which enables access to services such as the Menu API, Checkout API, and Profile API.
      Storefront storefront​(java.util.Optional<SDKConfiguration> serviceConfiguration)
      Configure and return a customized instance of the Storefront facade, which enables access to a battery of APIs included in the Cookies Storefront Service.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.io.Closeable

        close

    • Method Detail

      • catalog

        @Nonnull
default CatalogClient catalog()
        Access a pre-configured instance of the CatalogClient, which enables access to the Catalog API.

        The Catalog API is a service meant for trading partners, development partners, and other affiliated organizations, and calls an API backend which requires authentication with an API key, and, depending on scope, authorized credentials.

        These credentials and keys can be acquired through the Tech@Cookies team. See main library docs for more information.

        Returns:
        Pre-configured Catalog API client.

      • storefront

        @Nonnull
default Storefront storefront()
        Access a pre-configured instance of the Storefront facade, which enables access to services such as the Menu API, Checkout API, and Profile API.

        The Storefront Service is organized into multiple individual APIs, each of which are meant for different roles in the supply chain played by Cookies trading partners, development partners, and other affiliated organizations. Calls to the API backend require authentication with API keys, and, depending on required scope, authorized user credentials.

        These credentials and keys can be acquired through the Tech@Cookies team. See main library docs for more information.

        Returns:
        Pre-configured Storefront facade.

      • catalog

        @Nonnull
CatalogClient catalog​(@Nonnull
                      java.util.Optional<SDKConfiguration> serviceConfiguration)
        Configure and return a customized instance of the CatalogClient, which enables access to the Catalog API.

        The Catalog API is a service meant for trading partners, development partners, and other affiliated organizations, and calls an API backend which requires authentication with an API key, and, depending on scope, authorized credentials.

        These credentials and keys can be acquired through the Tech@Cookies team. See main library docs for more information.

        Note: Instead of configuring a custom service, invoking code should consider using the builder methods for CookiesSDK, which keep configuration uniform across services.

        Parameters:
        serviceConfiguration - Custom configuration to apply to the resulting catalog service.
        Returns:
        Configured Catalog API client.

      • storefront

        @Nonnull
Storefront storefront​(@Nonnull
                      java.util.Optional<SDKConfiguration> serviceConfiguration)
        Configure and return a customized instance of the Storefront facade, which enables access to a battery of APIs included in the Cookies Storefront Service.

        The Storefront API is a service meant for trading partners, development partners, and other affiliated organizations, and calls an API backend which requires authentication with an API key, and, depending on scope, authorized credentials.

        These credentials and keys can be acquired through the Tech@Cookies team. See main library docs for more information.

        Note: Instead of configuring a custom service, invoking code should consider using the builder methods for CookiesSDK, which keep configuration uniform across services.

        Parameters:
        serviceConfiguration - Custom configuration to apply to the resulting catalog service.
        Returns:
        Configured Storefront API facade.
